availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph G. Campbell (Marion County, Kentucky, merchant)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Margaret B. Cambell. Father of Florence Campbell, Mary Lucy Campbell, Henrietta Campbell, Joseph W. Campbell, John R. Campbell, and Ive W. Campbell. Merchant in Adair County, Kentucky in 1850. Merchant in Marion County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned one enslaved individual in Marion County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 2, p. 70B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, p. 552.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, p. 11.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, p. 60A.
Find A Grave, "Joseph G. Campbell (June 1818-May 1883)," Memorial #112251386, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/112251386 (accessed April 20, 2020).
